title: WCAS PSYCH 201-0-25 Statistical Methods in Psychology
class_attributes:
Formal Studies Distro Area

Prerequisites apply, see description

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: An introduction to basic descriptive and inferential statistics commonly used in psychological research. Topics will include measures of central tendency and variability, z-scores, normal distribution, hypothesis testing, t-tests, ANOVA, chi-square tests, and correlation.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: High school algebra and PSYCH 110 or equivalent. This course counts toward the Weinberg College formal studies distribution requirement.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Teaching Method: Lecture, in-class team problem sets.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation Method: Grades will be based on weekly quizzes, two exams, in-class team problem sets, individual problem sets, and a short paper.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Textbook: Glenberg, A. & Andrzejewski, M. (2008). Learning from Data: An Introduction to Statistical Reasoning (3rd Edition) Mahwah, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum. ISBN: 9780805849219

subject: PSYCH
